ratings.comment: Obviously a professor who cares a lot about his students and his lectures. Very humorous and intelligent when discussing the topics of human geography.
Lectures are boring and hard to follow. He talks and talks but rarely gets to his point. Exams and essays are not difficult. It's an okay class.
A super smart and nice professor. He doesn't just teach facts, but values ideas which I appreciate.

Not a great lecturer, slides are not good for taking notes. Be prepared to just listen and take notes from what he is saying verbally. He's a good guy and knows what he's talking about, but just not very streamlined lectures. My notes were super bare in the beginning before I just started doing notes from what I was hearing.

Most boring lectures ever. I'm sure he is a brilliant human geographer, but when it comes to lecturing, not at all. He opposes having the lecture notes and videos on Canvas for no reason. Actually, he probably doesn't post lectures because nobody would show up to lecture. He is a yapper. He talks so much without saying anything meaningful.

GEO 300 WEIRD GEO NOT 301
If you liked Socratic/ Discussion days in high school you'll like this one. He's really passionate about class and always available for meetings. Group-based = attendance heavy, but he's not a stickler. Some group work & a few papers but they're really your choice content-wise. Definitely would take a class with him again.

Keith Woodward is an amazing professor, by far in my Top 3! I had ZERO knowledge about geography, but this was such a manageable and engaging course! Essay-heavy, but you get tons of feedback and time to work on them. Take if you're not the best test-taker. He is the sweetest and he kind of reminds me of a koala calico critter!

Keith is a great professor. I'm actually in Geog 511 -- Keith makes everyone in the class feel cared for and respected while teaching us important material in a digestible manner. Asks for feedback often from his students and isn't one of those profs who feel the need to exert power over their students. Better for higher level courses  than 100s

Good professor. Lectures were posted so most people just watched those and didn't go to class. Not a heavy workload. Just watch the recordings and you won't have to read the textbook. Grading felt TA dependent. Be aware of the grade distribution for this class on madgrades and the "course grader". Don't slack on anything and you'll be fine
TBH, I haven't been to this class since the first week of the semester. Lectures that I went to were kinda boring. I somehow have an A. He reminds me of santa clause.

Keith made the transition to online classes very easy and the class was very organized for having such a short amount of time to get everything together for the fall semester. The lectures are long and very boring to watch but a lot of the material is common sense so the lectures didn't seem to be very mandatory. Assignments were not graded hard.

Professor Woodward seemed like a nice guy who was very passionate about Human Geography. I found the lectures to be somewhat boring and often felt like he went on tangents. It was sometimes unclear what was needed to be known for the test and what was supposed to be in the Essays. Overall, I think this was a mediocre class.

If you find geography boring, you're probably going to find geography 101 lectures boring, even though Woodward is super passionate and knowledgeable about geography. He spent a couple lectures talking about problems with capitalism, but lectures were not nearly as politically charged as other reviews made it seem. Good geography professor overall

Awful. This class shouldn't have been this difficult. Extremely boring lectures and when we transitioned to online learning we were required to watch massively long lectures every week. Assigned a 10-page essay final to be done in 3 days after ranting about how no one watched the lectures. Graded on 4 assignments. Wouldnt recommend taking!

Awful. Lectures were already tangent ridden liberal mini rants, but with online classes, he posts 3 hour long video lectures and wonders why less than half the students watch them. Graded based on 4 assignments total so no wiggle room, make sure to put in effort. Overall just an awful professor, probably would be better off as a storyteller.

Keith is one of the best professors I've had in college and is really passionate about what he teaches. I truly enjoyed coming to class and feel much more cultured than when I walked in. However, you're only graded on literally 2 things, which are huge assignments, for the whole semester. Also, don't take this class if you're not liberal.

Professor Woodward is passionate about human geography and is a very accommodating prof; however, his class can get quite political at times and it shows in his selection of course readings and discussions. There is quite a bit of reading for the class, which definitely can be boring. You have plenty of time to do the papers and reading though.

One of my favorite professors ever. The topics presented in class are beautifully explained with case studies and relevant examples. Not the most interesting topics but he presents it in a way that makes it more interesting. Funny guy and is very encouraging

I don't understand how there can be so many extreme opinions about Professor Woodward. He is a genuine guy with a passion for human geography AND the lectures are not the greatest nor are the discussion sections. For me, this class was a middle of the road comm b requirement. I did not love it, but I did not hate it. Keith deserves more credit.
Daddy Keith always dropped mad dad jokes on lecture! Yeah yeah he goes on tangents but his passion for human geography is tangible and he is woke and just a respected guy.

Not a mandatory class and textbook is optional. Prof. Woodward's lectures are convoluted by his inability to clearly define the topics he's talking about. He always goes on tangents. Be prepared to hear "can you dig it?" every 10 minutes. If you're looking to take this class for a Comm-B requirement or to explore the field of geography, don't.

He is 'meh'. I feel like he dumbed things down too much for us sometimes. I wish that I would have learned more. He also tells jokes that aren't funny. You do not have to go to lecture to do well. It is a fun class though.

Turned a subject I had no interest in into an interesting class through his enthusiasm for the class. Lectures became tedious, however examples were interesting and made me think about how it relates to daily life. I rarely found discussion helpful, yet Professor Woodward always responded promptly if you emailed him regarding terms for the test.

Woodward is passionate about human geography.  Lectures are on intellectually stimulating topics, but can be long and tangent filled. Two papers, both allow you to run with a specific topiccase study.  Tests are example based. does a good job of running through the examples you need to know in lecture.  Find the connections and youll be fine.

His lectures are very in depth and can be confusing. There isn't a clear layout of the class and it's hard to figure out what material is important. Also, there are only two essay based tests (one midterm and one final), two papers, and one presentation. Used the book only to study for tests. Avoid this professor, it's hard to understand him.

Plenty of reading.  HARD concepts.  His lectures go off on tangents probably every three minutes.  He is super passionate about human geography, but does not explain everything in the most clear way.  His points get lost in translation and it's hard to follow.  Seems extraordinarily nice and outgoing, but way too high of a level for an intro class.

Pretty easy class. He is an interesting guy. Very passionate about what he does. Looks at the philosophical side of geography. Probably one the easiest Comm B classes you can take. 1 midterm and final exam (just go to the review sessions) and 2 6-page papers.

This isn't your typical Intro-level class, so definitely don't take it if you're looking for an easy A. He's really enthusiastic and is a nice and helpful guy, but the class is pretty difficult. He goes off on tangents quite a bit and that's where it's hard to follow him. Only had 2 papers along with the midterm & final plus the discussion grade.

Fascinating but hard class that is run like a grad level course. Exploring geography theories and philosophies is difficult so it is extremely important to keep up with the readings. Woodward is very enthusiastic about this subject and he is really, really helpful. Don't be afraid to talk to him during office hours!

you can tell he loves geography! He does go on some tangents but overall the class is pretty interesting and he is really dedicated. The material isn't hard and he outlines everything on his slides. Great class!

The material is extremely challenging, but woodward does NOT expect you to master it.  He just wants to see an honest attempt.  He will be pleased with anything you contribute.  Just make an effort to understand the readings and ideas and you will be fine.  He is very enthusiastic, animated, smart nice guy.

The lecture, which is more of a discussion between him and the grad students that are in the class, is absolutely horrible.  Its hard follow what he is talking about, particularly because he goes off on tangents.  The class has only 3 papers so that is nice, but the reading for the class is usually about 120-160 pages a week.  Avoid this class.

friendly guy, a bit confusing if you do not  know the geography terms that he uses. Lots of rants especially about monsanto. nuff said? (you will hear that a lot) powerpoints have tons of info on them, yet not relevant to the test or papers. study review sheets and go to discussions. but an enjoyable subject and class.
